data.event: Thomas Browne, the "Patuxent Ranger" explored westward through Anne Arundel county through Clarksville and settled in the area in 1702.

event.title: A century later in the civil war, confederate

data.event: A century later in the civil war, confederate general Bradley Tyler Johnson used Mt.
The B&O railroad ran though the area with a station built in 1835 for granite deliveries.
The postal community was named "Davis Tavern" when its first post office opened in 1836.
In 1869, the Jesuit Woodstock College opened on the Baltimore side of the Patapsco River.
In 1889, telegraph service was extended to town.
